<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> One of our writers, Toby Howell, won’t stop talking about a new training program he’s been sticking to. Created by Andy Frisella, it’s called “75 Hard” and requires a specific set of tasks to be completed every day for 75 days in a row. The tasks:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Complete two separate, 45-minute workouts. One of those </span><span><em>has </em></span><span>to be outside.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Drink one gallon of water</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Read 10 pages of a nonfiction book</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Stick to a diet of your choosing</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Take a progress picture </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Toby's on day #29 and supposedly has "developed a rhythm." Anyone want to join?</p>
</td>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/10/clubhouse-grows-welcomes-highprofile-users-platform?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Clubhouse's Graduation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Kanye West + Elon Musk" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDE4L2thbnllX3dlc3RfZWxvbl9tdXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted yesterday</a> that he’s going to have a conversation with Kanye West on Clubhouse, the fast-growing audio-based social media app. It’s not clear when they’ll chat, but we’ll be sure to relay the Musk-West 2024 campaign’s policy proposals as soon as we hear them. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The backstory </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Clubhouse perfectly timed its April 2020 launch to coincide with a global pandemic that kept everyone in their homes and dependent on their phones for social interaction. In May, it raised $12 million from venture capital/media company Andreessen Horowitz, and raised <a href="https://www.axios.com/clubhouse-andreessen-horowitz-3a10475a-becd-4483-a81e-9ce76d24e85f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another round</a> last month at a $1 billion valuation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How big is it?</strong> With its invite-only model, Clubhouse is sacrificing viral growth for the image of “exclusivity.” But plenty of people are still finding their way on. In late January, the startup said over 2 million people used the app in one week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s helped that some of those users are huge names. Elon Musk interviewed Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev about GameStop mania. Drake and Tiffany Haddish have hopped on. A few Morning Brew employees are known to dabble. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One other notable Clubhouse member: Mark Zuckerberg, who chatted about augmented/virtual reality. He apparently liked his time on the app a lot—Facebook is reportedly in the early stages of </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/technology/facebook-building-product-clubhouse.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">building</a></span><span> a Clubhouse competitor (Twitter has already launched one, known as Spaces). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what do you think?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Is Clubhouse a pandemic fad or will it eventually replace all physical human interaction? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Proponents of Clubhouse say the audio format allows for deep, spontaneous, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-02-09/clubhouse-success-shows-niceness-can-exist-on-social-media?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">respectful conversations</a>—the kind existing social media platforms aren’t exactly known for. For example, before it was shut down in China, the app provided an <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/09/technology/china-clubhouse.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uncensored space</a> for residents to debate the government’s actions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Skeptics say, “Let’s see how many of you want to be on Clubhouse when the Foo Fighters are playing Jones Beach,” arguing that interest will level off post-pandemic. Plus, the company hasn't figured out its revenue model, and many of the conversations are <a href="https://medialyte.substack.com/p/portrait-of-a-clubhouse-skeptic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">simply boring</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s your take? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/cQkxhaJw?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vote here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/10/lvmh-hits-pause-rihanna-fashion-house?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
LVMH Stops Fenty’s Music
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Rihanna at a Fenty fashion event at Bergdorf Goodman's " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDE3L3JpaGFubmFfZmVudHlfZmFzaGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Generally speaking, pausing Rihanna is a recipe for a dance floor revolt. But in the face of disappointing sales, French luxury conglomerate LVMH <a href="https://wwd.com/fashion-news/designer-luxury/rihanna-lvmh-close-fenty-fashion-house-1234725677/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has decided</a> to do just that with the singer’s upscale fashion house, Fenty. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Fenty launched in May 2019 to much excitement about a beloved celebrity with innovative personal style inaugurating a new era for old-fashioned LVMH; Fenty was the conglomerate’s first original house led by a woman. But then the coronavirus showed up and <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/3c06d7ab-cdec-4283-9745-4ebf02a14e84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clobbered</a> the luxury sector, especially newer, more experimental brands like Fenty. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fenty’s products, mostly luxury streetwear, also suffered from a minimalist distribution strategy and struggled to find a niche. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The winding down of Fenty only applies to RiRi’s foray into luxury fashion. Her skincare and cosmetics lines of the same name, plus the lingerie brand Savage X Fenty, are doing just fine. Savage X Fenty actually just raised $115 million in a round led by private equity firm L Catterton. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/10/meet-air-taxi-startup-going-public-via-spac?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Catch a Flight to the Airport, Thanks to the Latest SPAC
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Archer plane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDIwL2FyY2hlcl9wbGFuZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jeff Ludes/Archer Aviation</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, electric aircraft startup Archer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/10/united-airlines-orders-electric-vertical-aircraft-invests-in-urban-air-mobility-spac.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it will SPAC</a> into the public markets in a deal that values it at $3.8 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Companies focused on electric mobility are developing a reputation for checking the “go public via SPAC” box before the “develop a commercially viable product” one. Archer plans to unveil a prototype later this year, but consumer flights aren’t expected until 2024. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But wait, there’s more. </strong>United Airlines <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b2e63918-fca1-4ca6-b5bf-5e72a67133a6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it planned</a> to buy up to 200 of its younger, more eco-friendly cousin Archer’s flying taxis for $1 billion. It likes Archer’s pitch to whisk passengers short distances (up to 60 miles at 150 mph) across urban areas to airports, with a reduced carbon footprint. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Clubhouse and SPACs are in a riveting staring contest as the business world's top pandemic trends. SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, have raised more than $38 billion so far this year. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY E*TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
A Sweet Suite, No Suit Needed
</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25199091.291229285;dc_trk_aid=488067815;dc_trk_cid=145591584;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">E*TRADE has a comprehensive suite of financial offerings beyond trading.</strong> And they want to make one thing crystal clear: You don’t need to be a Fancy Shmancy Suit-wearin’ Finance Person to <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25199091.291231298;dc_trk_aid=488260624;dc_trk_cid=145591593;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put your money to work with their tools.</a></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lovin’ your PJs these days? No problemo. With E*TRADE, you <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25199091.291231298;dc_trk_aid=488260624;dc_trk_cid=145591593;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can work on your finance goals at home</a> while sporting your fuzziest robe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Say you’ve wanted to start investing, but you’ve always been intimidated by terms like “options” and “ETF.” <strong style="color:#000">E*TRADE’s tools simplify the investing experience</strong>, teaching you all you need to know and empowering you to start managing your money with confidence.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25199091.291231298;dc_trk_aid=488260624;dc_trk_cid=145591593;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">E*TRADE’s tools</a> simplify things like <strong style="color:#000">banking and retirement planning</strong>, too—whatever your money goals (and whatever your wardrobe).</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/10/cannabis-stocks-soar-reddit-gets-involved?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Cannabis Stocks Are Growing Like a Weed
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cannabis stocks <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/10/cannabis-stocks-soar-as-reddit-crowd-that-spiked-gamestop-jumps-in-tilray-surges-25percent.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blazed higher</a> yesterday, powered in part by increased interest from retail traders who maybe got tired of pumping dogecoin for a brief moment. Canadian cannabis company Tilray was the biggest winner, closing the day up 51%. Aurora Cannabis and Canopy Growth gained 21% and 6%, respectively. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Before you ask...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not really a GameStop situation. Yes, cannabis stocks are getting attention on Reddit forums (one post with over 100k upvotes said, “Weed about to make me a millionaire in 2021”), but the epic short squeeze that helped fuel GameStop’s rise isn’t happening on the same scale this time around.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Short interest in Tilray currently stands at </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-10/tilray-heads-for-best-3-day-gain-ever-as-pot-stocks-surge?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">around 23%</a></span><span> of shares outstanding, compared to the 114% GameStop was dealing with at one point. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, a pending merger between Tilray and another major Canadian pot company helps explain some of the investor optimism.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Outside of message boards or M&A hype, the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/cannabis-stocks-dealmaking-surge-legalization-looks-likelier?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">common drumbeat</a> behind weed stocks’ recent surge has been the Democratic party’s intention to legalize it at a national level.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIDEO GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/10/epic-games-releases-tool-help-developers-create-hyperrealistic-characters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Unreal Is Unreal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Unreal engine" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDIzL3VucmVhbF9lbmdpbmUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unreal</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, <em>Fortnite </em>creator Epic Games debuted its latest development tool that can help video game makers <a href="https://www.polygon.com/2021/2/10/22276368/epic-games-metahuman-creator-tool-unreal-engine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">create</a> hyper-realistic faces, facial animations, and body movements. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Powered by Epic’s Unreal Engine 5, “MetaHuman Creator” is basically a supercharged customize-your-avatar software for developers. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s a big deal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Anyone who’s played <em>NBA2K</em> or <em>FIFA</em> knows that developers haven’t quite nailed a truly believable human avatar. And it’s not for lack of trying: “Even the most experienced artists require significant amounts of time, effort, and equipment, just for one character,” Vladimir Mastilovic, the VP of Digital Humans Technology at Epic, said in a statement. But with MetaHuman, characters that used to take months to design can now be created and customized in a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/10/22276265/epic-games-digital-human-creator-unreal-engine-realistic-human-faces?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">matter of minutes</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> For decades, Epic has been leading the charge to build a virtual meta-reality, especially in its most popular game, <em>Fortnite</em>. This latest advancement, which will be available to developers as a free sample for now, will help bring other studios along with it. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Second monitor ideas: </strong>If you don’t need two screens full of Excel to function at work, we recommend filling your second (or third?) monitor with 1) hours of <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J2UyOTS3UCE&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">swimming squids</a> or a <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O34gKi2IHk4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">live jellyfish cam </a>from the Monterey Bay Aquarium, 2) <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7KXGZAEWzn0&feature=emb_title&utm_source=Benedict%27s+Newsletter&utm_campaign=73b595afd2-Benedict%27s+newsletter_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4999ca107f-73b595afd2-70650345&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">footage</a> of Earth from space, or the classic 3) <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5qap5aO4i9A&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lofi study buddy</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> is following NASA, the UAE, and China on some interstellar exploration. Join us on the final frontier with one of these books:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Being an astronaut sounds glamorous...but Mary Roach’s </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780393339918?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Packing for Mars</em></a></span><span> will leave you laughing and, at times, cringing at the reality of human space exploration. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781101980491?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>How to Make a Spaceship</em></a></span><span> by Julian Guthrie looks at the innovators who raced to develop reusable rockets for Peter Diamandis’s X Prize competition, which dangled a $10 million prize to spur commercial interest in space travel in the 1990s. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Christian Davenport’s </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781541774162?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Space Barons</em></a></span><span> profiles billionaires including Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk who have trained their sights on the stars. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Check out more of our favorite biz-related reads <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got killer dolls, bird poop, and much more in today’s headline quiz. You know the drill: Three of these crazy headlines come from real news stories, and one we made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“No, Chucky the killer doll isn’t on the loose, Texas officials </span><span><a href="https://www.thenewstribune.com/news/nation-world/national/article248875894.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a></span><span> after Amber Alert”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Seabird poop is </span><span><a href="https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/seabird-poop-worth-more-1-billion-annually-180975504/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth</a></span><span> more than $1 billion annually”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Wilbur Ross </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-09/wilbur-ross-sees-future-in-a-spac-trump-condos-on-the-moon?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sees</a></span><span> future in a SPAC, and ‘Trump Condos on the Moon’”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Inventor of ‘I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter’ </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/6GEXOLDr0CCBxXiCf8/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launches</a></span><span> new product, ‘I Can’t Believe It’s Not Vodka’”</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCatch up on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/trump-impeachment-trial-update-2-10-2021-4f49705a5f92bd4129941ec409642ecd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDay 2\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of Trump’s impeachment trial, the first full day of arguments. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePutting a cloth mask over your surgical mask—a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cdc-report-double-masking-can-block-more-90-percent-viral-n1257256?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edouble-mask\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, if you will—offers significantly more protection against the coronavirus, the CDC said yesterday. Meanwhile, cases \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2021/02/10/covid-19-cases-are-falling-variant-driven-storm/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinue to plummet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the US, though the presence of more contagious variants clouds any future outlook.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFed Chair Jerome Powell went glass \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/10/fed-chair-powell-citing-bleak-jobs-picture-says-policy-will-need-to-stay-patiently-accommodative.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethree-quarters empty\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in a speech to the Economic Club of New York yesterday. He said the fragile economy needs continued support from the Fed, and that unemployment numbers understate the true impact of the coronavirus on the labor market. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nClubhouse's Graduation\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Kanye West + Elon Musk\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDE4L2thbnllX3dlc3RfZWxvbl9tdXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eElon Musk \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted yesterday\u003c/a\u003e that he’s going to have a conversation with Kanye West on Clubhouse, the fast-growing audio-based social media app. It’s not clear when they’ll chat, but we’ll be sure to relay the Musk-West 2024 campaign’s policy proposals as soon as we hear them. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe backstory \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClubhouse perfectly timed its April 2020 launch to coincide with a global pandemic that kept everyone in their homes and dependent on their phones for social interaction. In May, it raised $12 million from venture capital/media company Andreessen Horowitz, and raised \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/clubhouse-andreessen-horowitz-3a10475a-becd-4483-a81e-9ce76d24e85f.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanother round\u003c/a\u003e last month at a $1 billion valuation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow big is it?\u003c/strong\u003e With its invite-only model, Clubhouse is sacrificing viral growth for the image of “exclusivity.” But plenty of people are still finding their way on. In late January, the startup said over 2 million people used the app in one week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s helped that some of those users are huge names. Elon Musk interviewed Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev about GameStop mania. Drake and Tiffany Haddish have hopped on. A few Morning Brew employees are known to dabble. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne other notable Clubhouse member: Mark Zuckerberg, who chatted about augmented/virtual reality. He apparently liked his time on the app a lot—Facebook is reportedly in the early stages of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/technology/facebook-building-product-clubhouse.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilding\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a Clubhouse competitor (Twitter has already launched one, known as Spaces). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what do you think?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIs Clubhouse a pandemic fad or will it eventually replace all physical human interaction? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProponents of Clubhouse say the audio format allows for deep, spontaneous, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-02-09/clubhouse-success-shows-niceness-can-exist-on-social-media?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erespectful conversations\u003c/a\u003e—the kind existing social media platforms aren’t exactly known for. For example, before it was shut down in China, the app provided an \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/09/technology/china-clubhouse.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euncensored space\u003c/a\u003e for residents to debate the government’s actions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSkeptics say, “Let’s see how many of you want to be on Clubhouse when the Foo Fighters are playing Jones Beach,” arguing that interest will level off post-pandemic. Plus, the company hasn't figured out its revenue model, and many of the conversations are \u003ca href=\"https://medialyte.substack.com/p/portrait-of-a-clubhouse-skeptic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esimply boring\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s your take? \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/cQkxhaJw?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVote here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGenerally speaking, pausing Rihanna is a recipe for a dance floor revolt. But in the face of disappointing sales, French luxury conglomerate LVMH \u003ca href=\"https://wwd.com/fashion-news/designer-luxury/rihanna-lvmh-close-fenty-fashion-house-1234725677/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas decided\u003c/a\u003e to do just that with the singer’s upscale fashion house, Fenty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eFenty launched in May 2019 to much excitement about a beloved celebrity with innovative personal style inaugurating a new era for old-fashioned LVMH; Fenty was the conglomerate’s first original house led by a woman. But then the coronavirus showed up and \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3c06d7ab-cdec-4283-9745-4ebf02a14e84?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclobbered\u003c/a\u003e the luxury sector, especially newer, more experimental brands like Fenty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFenty’s products, mostly luxury streetwear, also suffered from a minimalist distribution strategy and struggled to find a niche. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe winding down of Fenty only applies to RiRi’s foray into luxury fashion. Her skincare and cosmetics lines of the same name, plus the lingerie brand Savage X Fenty, are doing just fine. Savage X Fenty actually just raised $115 million in a round led by private equity firm L Catterton. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, electric aircraft startup Archer \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/10/united-airlines-orders-electric-vertical-aircraft-invests-in-urban-air-mobility-spac.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it will SPAC\u003c/a\u003e into the public markets in a deal that values it at $3.8 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompanies focused on electric mobility are developing a reputation for checking the “go public via SPAC” box before the “develop a commercially viable product” one. Archer plans to unveil a prototype later this year, but consumer flights aren’t expected until 2024. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut wait, there’s more. \u003c/strong\u003eUnited Airlines \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/b2e63918-fca1-4ca6-b5bf-5e72a67133a6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it planned\u003c/a\u003e to buy up to 200 of its younger, more eco-friendly cousin Archer’s flying taxis for $1 billion. It likes Archer’s pitch to whisk passengers short distances (up to 60 miles at 150 mph) across urban areas to airports, with a reduced carbon footprint. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eClubhouse and SPACs are in a riveting staring contest as the business world's top pandemic trends. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003ecreator Epic Games debuted its latest development tool that can help video game makers \u003ca href=\"https://www.polygon.com/2021/2/10/22276368/epic-games-metahuman-creator-tool-unreal-engine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreate\u003c/a\u003e hyper-realistic faces, facial animations, and body movements. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePowered by Epic’s Unreal Engine 5, “MetaHuman Creator” is basically a supercharged customize-your-avatar software for developers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s a big deal\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnyone who’s played \u003cem\u003eNBA2K\u003c/em\u003e or \u003cem\u003eFIFA\u003c/em\u003e knows that developers haven’t quite nailed a truly believable human avatar. And it’s not for lack of trying: “Even the most experienced artists require significant amounts of time, effort, and equipment, just for one character,” Vladimir Mastilovic, the VP of Digital Humans Technology at Epic, said in a statement. But with MetaHuman, characters that used to take months to design can now be created and customized in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/10/22276265/epic-games-digital-human-creator-unreal-engine-realistic-human-faces?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ematter of minutes\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e For decades, Epic has been leading the charge to build a virtual meta-reality, especially in its most popular game, \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e. This latest advancement, which will be available to developers as a free sample for now, will help bring other studios along with it. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
